question.header: ACH/UAMS will be the lead entity for this study
question.question-label: Describe the communication between sites that might be relevant to the protection of participants, such as unanticipated problems, interim results, and protocol modifications.

question.header: ACH/UAMS will be the lead entity for this study
question.question-label: Describe IRB oversight arrangements for each site (i.e. who is providing IRB review and approval).
Provide the total number of subjects (or number of participant records, specimens, etc.) for whom you are seeking UAMS IRB oversight?
What is the total subject accrual goals for all sites for this study (if available)?
What age range(s) do the subjects fall into?
Name and describe the subject population(s) for the study.
Select all of the vulnerable populations that will be, or potentially could be, included in the study:
Select all of the vulnerable populations that will be targeted for participation in the study:

Where scientifically appropriate, describe preclinical studies (including studies on pregnant animals) and clinical studies (including studies on non-pregnant women), where scientifically appropriate, that provide data for assessing potential risks to pregnant women and fetuses.
Indicate for whom the prospect of direct benefit exists:
The risk to the fetus is:
Explain how the risks are the least possible for achieving the objectives of the research.
State who (other than investigators and key personnel) will determine the viability of a neonate and what procedures will be used to determine viability.
Describe preclinical studies and clinical studies, where scientifically appropriate, that provide data for assessing potential risks to neonates.
The viability of neonates to be involved in the research is:
For neonates of uncertain viability, the risk to the neonate is:
Explain how the research meets the condition selected above:
Explain how "Vital functions of the neonate will not be artificially maintained" is met.
Explain how "The research will not terminate the heartbeat or respiration of the neonate" is met.
Explain how "There will be no added risk to the neonate resulting from the research" is mett
Explain how "The purpose of the research is the development of important knowledge that cannot be obtained by other means" is met.
Indicate the category(ies) that best describes the involvement of prisoners in the research:
Provide the name, type of facility and location of each local, state, or federal facility to be used.
Describe the possible advantages to participating prisoners (i.e., compared to the general living conditions, medical care, quality of food, amenities, and opportunity for earnings in the prison).
Describe any additional steps that will be taken to avoid undue influence (i.e., considering the limited choice environment of the prison).
Explain how the risks involved in the research are similar to risks that would be accepted by non-prisoner volunteers.
Explain how prisoners will be selected for the study and/or assigned to treatment groups.
Describe safeguards in place to provide assurances that parole boards will not take into account a prisoner's participation in the research when making decisions regarding parole.

Describe follow-up examinations or care of participants to be provided after their participation has ended (including frequency and duration they will be available), as applicable, taking into account the varying lengths of individual prisoners' sentences.
Select the category that best describes the research and provide the corresponding information:

question.header: More than minimum risk and has direct benefit
question.question-label: Explain how the risk is justified by the anticipated benefit to the individual child.

question.header: More than minimum risk and has direct benefit
question.question-label: Explain how the relation of the anticipated benefit to the risk is at least as favorable to the child as that which would be presented by available alternative approaches (e.g., other treatments).

question.header: More than minimum risk and has no direct benefit
question.question-label: Explain how the risk represents a minor increase over minimal risk.

question.header: More than minimum risk and has no direct benefit
question.question-label: Describe how the study interventions or procedures are reasonably equivalent to actual or expected medical, dental, psychological, social or educational situations for the children.

question.header: More than minimum risk and has no direct benefit
question.question-label: Explain how the intervention or procedure is likely to yield generalizable knowledge about the child's disorder or condition that is of vital importance for the understanding or amelioration of the child's disorder or condition.
Will the parents or guardians be present with the child during discussions of the research?
Will sensitive or private information (e.g., questionnaires, test results) be shared with the parents/guardians?
Please explain:
Is there a possibility that any of the research participants will be wards of the State or any other agency or institution?
Which language(s) other than English will this study require?
List any investigator(s) and/or key personnel who are fluent in the language(s) of the participants.
Describe the provisions in place to provide interpretive services during the participant recruitment and consent processes.
Describe the provisions in place to provide translation services throughout the participants' duration in the study.
Describe the provisions in place to handle emergency contacts (i.e., questions, problems) from non-English speaking participants.
Describe the expected range of participant impairment. Explain how, and by whom, the capacity to consent/assent will be determined.
Indicate whether assent will be obtained and if so, describe the process. If assent will not be obtained, explain.
If capacity is expected to fluctuate during research participation, describe the process for ensuring ongoing consent.
Select the one category that best describes the research and provide the corresponding information:

question.header: Greater than minimum risk with direct benefit
question.question-label: Explain how anticipated benefits, compared to risks, are as favorable as the alternatives (e.g., other treatments).

question.header: Greater than minimum risk without direct benefit
question.question-label: Explain how the risk presents only a minor increase over minimal risk.
Describe the international sites(s). Provide location, name of local contact or investigator, and local contact information, as applicable.
Is there an Ethics Board or IRB at the international site(s)?

question.header: There is an Ethics Board or IRB at the international site(s)
question.question-label: List contact information for the Board:

Describe any cultural, political, religious, or other local influences that may affect conduct of the proposed research and how these will be addressed (e.g. issues posing potential threats, requiring changes in recruitment methods, etc.)

Describe any local exceptions to the required consent process and how these will be addressed (e.g., a request from outsiders to sign documents would be treated with suspicion based on customs, previous history, etc.)
Explain any benefits to the local community that will remain with the community once the research is complete.

Describe the researchers' experience with conducting research (or studying or residing) in the research setting, including any relationship(s) with the community from which participants will be recruited.

Provide the name, title, and contact information (including email addresses) for two individuals who are not affiliated with the research who are knowledgeable about the location and population who could serve as a consultants(s) regarding the proposed research.
Describe communication and oversight plans between the researcher(s) who will be on-site and those at UAMS.
Describe procedures for the transfer of data between the local setting and UAMS.
Indicate if any planned research procedures are considered to be standard of care in the country or location.
Will pregnant women be excluded from participation in this research?
Explain how the nature of the research requires/justifies their exclusion. Address means of pregnancy screening.
Will non-English speaking subjects be excluded from participation in this research?
Explain how the nature of the research requires/justifies their exclusion. Address means of screening.
How will potential subjects be identified?
Which types of advertising will be directed at research subjects?
List Websites and their URL (e.g. UAMSHealth.com)
What are the advertised criteria for this study?
Will compensation be provided to the subjects?

question.question-label: Describe the method and amount of compensation, and its appropriateness for the research setting. Identify the recipient of the compensation (participant and/or parent/guardian). Outline plans to pro-rate the compensation, if necessary.

question.header: HIPAA authorization waiver/alteration is being requested

question.header: HIPAA authorization waiver/alteration is being requested
question.question-label: Explain how the access, use, or disclosure of PHI presents no more than a minimal risk to the privacy of the individual.

question.header: HIPAA authorization waiver/alteration is being requested
question.question-label: Describe your plan to protect the identifiers (or links to identifiable data) associated with the PHI from improper use and disclosure, including where PHI will be stored, what security measures will be applied, and who will have access to the information. question.header: HIPAA authorization waiver/alteration is being requested
question.question-label: Will identifiers (or links to identifiable data) be destroyed?
Describe the plan to destroy the identifiers at the earliest opportunity consistent with the conduct of the research. Include when and how identifiers will be destroyed.
Provide the legal, health, or research justification for retaining the identifiers. Legal justification should include brief description/citation of the legal requirement.

question.header: HIPAA authorization waiver/alteration is being requested
